Front: How can you effectively learn a complex skill with many interdependent parts?
Back:
ЁЯТб Main Idea: Focus on one part at a time instead of trying to master everything at once. This is called Altering Focus.

ЁЯза Why?
Some skills (like brewing tea) are made of separate steps that can be learned independently. But many real-world skills (like playing StarCraft or coding) are deeply interdependent тАФ parts rely on each other and canтАЩt be isolated easily. So you can't break them down the same way.

ЁЯОо Example: Space Fortress Game Study
4 groups were taught to play a complex video game:
- Group 1: Just played the game (no focus)
- Group 2: Focused only on ship control first
- Group 3: Focused only on mine placement first
- Group 4: Focused on ship тЖТ then mine тЖТ then free play
тЬЕ Result: Group 4 performed best (2000+ points) vs. others (1000тАУ1500), even though all played equally long. Their shifting attention built better mental building blocks.

ЁЯкД Analogy:
ItтАЩs like learning to play guitar:
- First, focus on chords
- Then strumming
- Then rhythm
Later, combine them to play songs fluently.

1я╕ПтГг Choose one subskill
